{"step_by_step_thinking": "The base of an X-ray film is mentioned in Document [3]. It states that the thickness of the film base is the same in all types of film, but it does not specify the material. However, Document [0] mentions that in conventional radiography, X-rays pass through the body and hit a film screen receptor, a transparent film composed of a silver bromide crystal emulsion spread between polyester base sheets. This suggests that the base of an X-ray film is made of polyester.", "answer_choice": "A. Polyester"}
